page.title: 09WENNINGTON - SOCIAL COHESION
page.content: While the village school in Wennington was in operation the people saw more of each other as they took their children to and from school, but once the school closed in 1967 the main social pressure which had persuaded outsiders to become involved in the community was removed and most of the locals only see each other regularly at church services. The church is described as a socially cohesive force bringing scattered neighbours together. However, few social events are organised by the church. Tatham Sports Day was a big social occasion while the school was open; although it still exists it has ceased to have the same effect as earlier. Even Lower Tatham Council is felt to do little to try and create a sense of community.
